The menu button has now been enabled during game play. Pressing the menu button presents three options, Reset Game, New Game and Options. Reset Game clears the current board of all your progress and restores it to the starting configuration. New Game generates a brand new board with the same size and difficulty. Options presents the options menu where you can change the board size and difficulty. Changing either of these settings will generate a new board with the board size and difficulty you have chosen.
Enjoy!

Welcome to Tiluxe. You can always revisit this tutorial from the Options menu. Hit the back button to skip it. \n\n Tiluxe is about turning on the correct tiles to win the game. Selecting a tile once will turn it on (white). Selecting the same tile again will turn it off (black). Select it one more time to reset it. Turn on the tile above to continue the tutorial.

The legend around the board will change colors, from red to green, based on the state of the respective row or column. Red numbers indicate the row or column is not correct in terms of the number of tiles turned on. Green numbers indicate the row or column is correct. To continue, turn on the correct tile based on the legend values and colors.

Tiles that need to be turned on cannot be touching horizontally, vertically or diagonally. There are two single tiles that need to be turned on in this board. Use the fact that they cannot touch and the legend to turn on the two correct tiles. Note: every game will tell you what to turn on at the bottom of the screen and will follow this format. To continue, turn on the correct tiles. 

 Turn on:
 Two sets of one

Sometimes tiles that need to be turned on come in sets. A set is made up of two to four tiles placed together vertically or horizontally on the board. The tiles that make up a set are allowed to touch the other tiles in the set. However, sets cannot touch other tiles on the board that also need to be turned on. Just like the no touching rule discussed previously. To continue, turn on the correct tiles.

The different difficulty levels change the number of free empty and turned on tiles given to you at the start of a game. Free empty tiles are black with a T in them and do not change state. Use these to help you locate the other tiles on the board that need to be turned on. To continue, turn on the correct tiles.

Excellent work! You have mastered all of the rules of Tiluxe. Lets play one more game before cutting you loose. Remember, you can always view this tutorial again from the Options menu. You can also change the difficulty level and board size from the Options menu by pressing Settings, or by pressing the Menu button during a game.
